articles.title: Greetings to Thai King
articles.content:
Greetings to Thai King
 Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to Bhumibol Adulyadej, King of Thailand, Thursday on the occasion of his birthday and the national day of his country.
					 Sincerely wishing the king good health and happiness and the friendly Thai people stability and prosperity, Kim in the message expressed the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in various fields.

articles.title: Greetings to Bulgarian PM
articles.content:
Greetings to Bulgarian PM
Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- Premier of the DPRK Cabinet Kim Yong Il sent a message of greetings to his Bulgarian counterpart Sergei Stanishev on Monday on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic ties between the DPRK and Bulgaria.
					 Noting that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries have favorably developed in the mutual interests over the past 60 years since the establishment of bilateral diplomatic ties, the message expressed hope that the bilateral relations would continue to develop in various fields by the joint efforts in the future, too.

articles.title: Greetings to Bulgarian FM
articles.content:
Greetings to Bulgarian FM
Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun sent a message of greetings to his Bulgarian counterpart Ivailo Kalfin, who is deputy Prime Minister, on Monday on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic ties between the DPRK and Bulgaria.
					 The message noted that after the establishment of their diplomatic ties the two countries have invariably developed their friendly relations on good terms and the friendship between the peoples of the two countries has been deepened in the course.
					
					 It expressed hope that the excellent cooperative relationship between the two ministries of foreign affairs would further promote the development of the bilateral relations for the well-being and prosperity of the peoples of the two countries.

articles.title: Day of Revolutionary Armed Forces of Cuba Observed
articles.content:
Day of Revolutionary Armed Forces of Cuba Observed
 Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- Miguel Angel Gala Valiente, military attache of the embassy of the Republic of Cuba here, hosted a reception at the Taedonggang Club for the Diplomatic Corps on Wednesday on the occasion of the 52nd anniversary of the day of the Revolutionary Armed Forces of Cuba.
					 Present there on invitation were Pak Jae Gyong, vice-minister of the People's Armed Forces, general officers of the Korean People's Army and other KPA officers, officials concerned, diplomatic envoys of various countries and military attaches of foreign embassies here.
					
					 Jose Manuel Galego Montano, ambassador of the Republic of Cuba to the DPRK, and staff members of his embassy were on hand. 
					
					 Speeches were made there.

articles.title: Korea, Eastern Country of Good Manners
articles.content:
Korea, Eastern Country of Good Manners
Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- Korea with time-honored history and brilliant cultural tradition has long been known to the world as an eastern country of good manners.
					 The neighboring countries called Korea the country of true gentlemen from ancient times in a sense that there lived virtuous, dignified, kind and sainted people.
					
					 History records write that besides the country of true gentlemen, Korea was called as true gentlemen's country, country of good manners, etc. in the east. 
					
					 Korea came to have such good name because her people are courteous, possess noble trait, treat guests with virtues and accord kind hospitality to them.
					
					 It is the disposition inherent to the Koreans to respect the elder, love the junior, be upright, hold dear obligation and faithfulness and behave kindly and courteously.
					
					 These moral characters have been formed and cemented in creative labor activities and struggle against the aggressors, carrying forward the one and the same blood, history and cultural traditions for thousands of years.
					
					 The Korean people have displayed to the full the spirit of unity, cooperation and fraternity, sharing weal and woe in the struggle for defending the country against foreign invaders down through history.
					
					 Today the beautiful moral traits are being carried forward more admirably to suit the feeling and emotion of the Korean people in the present Songun era.

articles.title: Highly Medicinal Korean Kimchi
articles.content:
Highly Medicinal Korean Kimchi
Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- Korean kimchi, a traditional national food, has a peculiar taste and highly medicinal value.
					 Containing much polysaccharide and lignin, the kimchi proves highly effective in the prevention and the treatment of hypertension, hyperlipemia, heart diseases and hypertrophy.
					
					 The physiological activators of the red pepper and the garlic in kimchi plays the role of preventing cell aging, sterilizing noxious germ, killing pain, improving immunity and the like.   
					
					 In particular, the garlic kills the germ causing food poisoning and stomach ulcer and activates the energy metabolism, thus having good influence on relieving fatigue and increasing vigor.
					
					 The kimchi which is seasoned with medicinal materials is called as medicinal kimchi.
					
					 The kimchi with about 40g fruit of Crataegus pinnatifida per head of cabbage is efficacious for heart stimulation, depression of the blood pressure, extension of the blood vessel, prevention against the cholesterol absorption, promotion of animal fat foodstuff digestion and so on.  
					
					 The kimchi seasoned with Dioscorea batas is good for lowering blood sugar, preventing aging and curing diabetes and poor appetite.

articles.title: Japanese Imperialists' Crime in Plundering Cultural Remains
articles.content:
Japanese Imperialists' Crime in Plundering Cultural Remains
Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- The Japanese imperialists committed never-to-be-condoned crimes by spoiling the Korean people of large quantities of priceless cultural remains permeated with their creative wisdom and artistic talent in the bygone days.
					 Out of them, the ancient tomb robbery and pillage of porcelain show in all nakedness the shameless and gangster-like nature of the Japanese imperialists.
					
					 As the Japanese said that the Imjin Patriotic War (1592-1598) against the Japanese invaders was a "porcelain war", the Japanese imperialists carried away valuable Koryo celadon and porcelains of Ri Dynasty right and left and kidnapped hundreds of ceramic technicians.
					
					 The plunder of porcelains by the Japanese aggressors became more pronounced since their complete seizure of Korea's national sovereignty through the concoction of the "Ulsa Five-Point Treaty" in November 1905. They set in motion all the government authority and military forces to commit such crimes in a more organized and planned way.
					
					According to the Japanese, 40,000 pieces of cultural remains of Korea including porcelain-ware are on display in the Tokyo National Museum.
					
					 The Japanese imperialists dug out thousands of old tombs including kings' mausoleums in different parts of Korea under the patronage of their aggressive army.
					
					 Ito Hirobumi, first "Japanese resident-general" in Korea, stole ceramic-ware of national treasure which had been preserved down through generations in the Changdok Palace, Toksu Palace, Kyongbok Palace and so on to present them to the Japanese "Emperor", imperial family and nobles or to sell them to museums and antique dealers of Japan at expensive prices in conspiracy with his subordinates.
					
					 The second "resident-general" had the cheek to rave that the pillage came across public criticism because "it was done in secret", adding that "formal presentation of gifts will not cause any hindrance". He took the lead in robbing Korea of cultural relics.
					
					It is hard to see untouched tombs with mounds among the old tombs in the area of Rakrang District, Pyongyang. Except several tombs, the Japanese robbers dug out nearly 1,000 tombs. This fact indicts in all nakedness the brutal and vicious nature of the Japanese imperialists' plunder of cultural wealth.
					
					 They rigged up various "committees", "study societies", "laws" and etc. to encrust the predatory acts of cultural relics with "legality" and thus committed the pillage in a more open way. They also shipped to Japan other relics, to say nothing of first-class relics, asset of the nation.
					
					 The brazen-faced Japanese government has registered the fine porcelains of Korea, that the Japanese imperialists had robbed her of in the past, as its "national treasure", "important cultural wealth" and "weighty art objects".
					
					 The Japanese government must sincerely admit and apologize for the extra-large crimes in plundering Korea of her precious cultural relics and return all of them to Korea.

articles.title: Ri Hoe Chang Accused of Inciting Inter-Korean Confrontation
articles.content:
Ri Hoe Chang Accused of Inciting Inter-Korean Confrontation
Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- Traitor Ri Hoe Chang, president of the Party for Freedom and Progress of south Korea, let loose a spate of malignant vituperation that it is necessary to take this time when the inter-Korean relations are at the worst phase as an opportunity "to put an end to the undesirable exchange" and the Lee Myung Bak regime should "imperturbably cope" with the present situation.  He went the lengths of blustering that "new relations are possible only when the north has no card to play," while talking about "card" that can be used by the north.
					 Commenting on such reckless behavior, Rodong Sinmun Thursday says:
					
					 What this traitor uttered is aimed at giving a shot in the arm of the Lee group now driven to a pretty fix after being strongly rebuffed and denounced by the public at home and abroad for their unprecedented treacherous and anti-reunification moves and quelling the demand of the people from all walks of life, including the progressive forces, for a switchover in the traitorous regime's anachronistic "policy towards the north".
					
					 It is, indeed, disgusting to see the traitor make desperate efforts to stem the trend of the times as he has come out of the graveyard of history, finding him hard to properly breathe, cursed and assailed by the public. 
					
					 The outbursts let loose by Ri to incite confrontation while going reckless, unaware of his miserable position, sound as no more than a jargon made by a politician on his death-bed. 
					
					 Those confrontational maniacs going against the will of the nation and swimming against the trend of the times can never have long innings but will never be able to escape the curse and denunciation of the nation. 
					
					 The south Korean people will surely mete out a stern judgment to Ri so that he may no longer raise his head again as he persistently kicks off confrontational hysteria in a bid to realize his foolish ambition, oblivious of the lesson taught by his political career as a traitor.

articles.title: Imperialists' Strategy for World Domination Bound to Go Bust
articles.content:
Imperialists' Strategy for World Domination Bound to Go Bust
Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- No matter how desperately the imperialists may work, they can never succeed in dominating the world nor can they stem the trend of history towards independence.
					 Rodong Sinmun Thursday says this in a by-lined article. 
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 The imperialists' strategy for world domination is bound to go bust because this diametrically runs counter to the law governing the development of history and the trend of the present times towards multi-polarization.
					
					 Socialism represents the ideal which embodies the intrinsic nature of social being desirous of leading an independent life on the basis of equality free from the exploitation and oppression of man by man. It is the inexorable law governing the development of history for humankind to head for socialism.
					
					 The imperialists are keen to hold in check the onward movement of history, a shift to socialism from capitalism, painting the collapse of socialism in some countries as the "end" of the cause of socialism. This is nothing but an anachronistic attempt.
					
					 History is sure to advance under the banner of independence.
					
					 The trend of the situation and changes taking place in Latin America go to prove that no force can deter the people from advancing along the road of independence and socialism.
					
					 It is the irresistible basic trend of the present times for all countries to call for independence and for the world to move towards multi-polarization. The U.S. is keen to dominate and subjugate other countries as it pleases, styling itself the world's "only super power" quite contrary to the above-said trend. This is, however, no more than a pipedream.
					
					 It is a hard reality that the imperialists' strategy to dominate the world is going bankrupt. This is neither temporary phenomenon nor something happening due to a temporary factor. It is the necessity of history that the imperialists' strategy to dominate the world against independence and humankind is bound to go bankrupt.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak Group Assailed for Evading Responsibility for Deteriorated Inter-Korean Relations
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak Group Assailed for Evading Responsibility for Deteriorated Inter-Korean Relations 
 Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- The crucial measure of strictly restricting and cutting off all the overland passages through the Military Demarcation Line (MDL) has been in force since Dec. 1 as the DPRK side had already informed the south Korean side of it.
					 Minju Joson Thursday observes in a signed commentary carried in this regard:
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak group is taking issue with this measure, terming it "a habitual threat" and "hold-out-to-the-last strategy". This is a revelation of the group's sinister intention to lay the blame for having brought the inter-Korean relations to the phase of total severance at the door of the north side. 
					
					 No matter what sort of artifice the Lee group may employ it can not evade the responsibility for having pushed the inter-Korean relations to a stalemate. Its behavior is extremely getting on the nerves of the army and people of the DPRK as it is an unpardonable challenge to the DPRK which has worked hard to prevent the inter-Korean relations from a stalemate at any cost and achieve independent reunification, peace and prosperity.
					
					 It is hard to expect improved inter-Korean relations or peaceful reunification as long as the group of traitors is allowed to stay in power. 
					
					 The evermore desperate efforts on the part of the puppets will only add to their crimes and they will have to face a more stern punishment of the nation for these crimes.
					
					 The Lee group had better admit the responsibility for having pushed the inter-Korean relations to the phase of total severance, make an apology to the nation and opt for a switchover in its "policy towards the north" which calls for confrontation with fellow countrymen, before it is too late.

articles.title: Actions for Abolition of NSL Staged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Actions for Abolition of NSL Staged in S. Korea
Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- People from all walks of life on December 1 staged actions for the repeal of the anti-reunification fascist law in various parts of south Korea.
					 The Solidarity for Implementing the South-North Joint Declaration  held a press conference in Seoul at which it stated that it could confirm the will of the people to struggle for the repeal of the "National Security Law (NSL)" in the course of waging a 57 day-long "sit-in strike on the situation for frustrating the crackdown upon participants in candlelight actions, foiling the case faked up against the Solidarity for Implementing the South-North Joint Declaration and getting the NSL abolished." 
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak "government" should bear in mind that its reckless crackdown through the invocation of the evil law is little short of precipitating its self-destruction, the solidarity warned.
					
					 The Solidarity for Progress of south Korea opened a photo and information exhibition in Seoul disclosing the history of the crimes committed by the force of the NSL.
					
					 The Kwangju and South Jolla Provincial Headquarters of  the South Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration, the South Kyongsang Provincial Council for People's Living and Democracy and victims of the NSL in the area of South Kyongsang Province held a press conference strongly demanding the abolition of the NSL. 
					
					 An action demanding the repeal of the above-said evil law was staged in Pusan with at least 30 civic and public organizations involved.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak Urged to Step Down
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak Urged to Step Down
 Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- The Youth and Students Solidarity for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration of south Korea issued a statement on Dec. 1 in denunciation of the Lee Myung Bak group's treacherous and anti-reunification moves for confrontation with fellow countrymen.
					 The statement held that the role performed by the Lee regime as a main player in the adoption of the "resolution on human rights in the north" co-sponsored by the U.S. and its followers is touching off the resentment of the Koreans.
					
					 Recalling that the present authorities threatened the lives of the people through the import of American beef fraught with the danger of mad cow disease and indiscriminately cracked down upon millions of people who struggled against this import after labeling them "leftist forces," the statement said that it is ridiculous of traitor Lee to dare talk about "the human rights issue in the north."
					
					 The statement accused the Lee group of threatening the people's living through sycophancy towards the U.S. and its policy of economic bankruptcy, blocking national reconciliation, cooperation and reunification and persisting in the moves for a war of aggression against the north.
					
					 The statement urged Lee to step down at once as he has opposed the implementation of the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration and stood in the way of achieving independent national reunification and peace and prosperity.

articles.title: Japan's Document on Tok Islet Discovered
articles.content:
Japan's Document on Tok Islet Discovered
 Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- A document was discovered at the Hamada History Hall in Shimane Prefecture of Japan. It proves that Japan admitted that Tok Islet is part of the territory of Korea. 
					 Prof. Kim Mun Gil at Pusan University of Foreign Studies in south Korea made it clear on Dec. 1 that he discovered the document at the history hall at the beginning of this year.    
					
					 This document was sent by the then governor of Shimane Prefecture to different fishing villages in the prefecture in February of 1838. The keynote of it says that any intruder into Juk Islet (Ullung Islet) is liable to capital punishment (death sentence).
					
					 Recorded in the document are the facts that a Japanese fisherman was punished with death for violating the "ordinance banning the sailing" to Juk Islet and Song Islet (Tok Islet) promulgated by Japan's feudal government after in the 1690s An Ryong Bok and other Koreans went to Japan and made it admit that Ullung Islet and Tok Islet belong to Korea and got assurances that Japan would not let Japanese intrude into those places any more.
					
					 The Japanese government punished the owner of a fishing boat in Yonago, Tottori Prefecture, which was secretly engaged in the fishing operation in the waters off Ullung Islet in violation of the above-said ordinance and sent texts of the document to the heads of the fishing villages in a bid to prevent the recurrence of such case and received even signatures and seals from them. 
					
					 Still clear on the document are signatures made by the then heads of the fishing villages.
					
					 "The results of the interrogation made by the Japanese government of the above-said ship owner and other information confirm that Tok Islet was mentioned in the ordinance", Kim said, adding: This testified to Japan's admission of the fact that the islet belongs to the territory of Korea.
					
					 He also recalled that Japanese scholars also agreed with the above-said fact.

articles.title: Ecuadorian National Preparatory Committee Formed
articles.content:
Ecuadorian National Preparatory Committee Formed
Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- An inaugural ceremony for the Ecuadorian National Preparatory Committee for Commemorating the Day of the Sun and February 16 in 2009 was held in Quito on Nov. 26.
					 At the ceremony Milton Burbano, chairman of the Ecuadorian Cultural Institute for the Study of the Juche Idea, was elected general coordinator of the preparatory committee and Daniel Alvarez Celi, chairman of the Ecuadorian Committee for Supporting Korea's Independent and Peaceful Reunification, chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The preparatory committee decided to organize diverse political and cultural events including meeting, book and photo exhibition and other functions and the arrangement of a special TV program from Jan. 15 to the Day of the Sun in 2009.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Work Published in Barbados
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Work Published in Barbados
 Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung's famous work "For Carrying Forward and Accomplishing the Socialist Cause" was brought out in pamphlet in Barbados on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the foundation of the DPRK.
					 The work deals with the talks Kim Il Sung gave to anti-Japanese revolutionary fighters and the bereaved children of revolutionaries on March 13, Juche 81 (1992) and January 20 and March 3, Juche 82 (1993).
					
					 The work clarifies the idea that socialism in the DPRK is a genuine society for the people and the whole party and all the people should unite close around General Secretary Kim Jong Il and remain true to his leadership in order to defend socialism in the DPRK and successfully accomplish the revolutionary cause of Juche.

articles.title: Ecuador: comite preparatorio por efemerides coreanas de 2009
articles.content:
Ecuador: comite preparatorio por efemerides coreanas de 2009
Pyongyang, 4 de diciembre (ATCC) -- Quedo constituido el 26 de noviembre en Quito el comite preparatorio nacional del Ecuador para el Dia del Sol (15 de abril, cumpleanos del Presidente Kim Il Sung) y el 16 de febrero (cumpleanos del Dirigente Kim Jong Il) de 2009.
					  En la ocasion, como el coordinador general y el presidente de la entidad naciente, fueron electos el presidente del Instituto Ecuatoriano Cultural por el Estudio de la Idea Juche, Milton Burbano, y el titular del Comite Ecuatoriano de Apoyo a la Reunificacion Independiente y Pacifica de Corea, Daniel Alvarez Celi, respectivamente.
					
					  El comite decidio organizar diversas actividades politicas y culturales como el mitin, la exposicion de libros y fotos y la transmision especial por TV en el periodo desde el 15 de enero hasta el Dia del Sol del proximo ano.

articles.title: Agregado militar cubano ofrece banquete por efemeride cubana
articles.content:
Agregado militar cubano ofrece banquete por efemeride cubana
Pyongyang, 4 de diciembre (ATCC) -- Con motivo del 52o aniversario del Dia de las Fuerzas Armadas Revolucionarias de Cuba, el agregado militar de la Embajada de la Republica de Cuba en Corea, Miguel Angel Gala Valiente, ofrecio el dia 3 un banquete en el Club Taedonggang para el Cuerpo Diplomatico.
					  A la ocasion fueron invitados el viceministro de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares Pak Jae Gyong, generales y oficiales del Ejercito Popular de Corea, funcionarios coreanos, los representantes diplomaticos de varios paises y agregados militares de embajadas en Corea.
					
					  Se distinguian tambien el embajador Jose Manuel Galego Montano y otros miembros de la embajada cubana.
					
					  En la recepcion hubo discursos.

articles.title: Hallado archivo de Japon sobre la pertenencia de isla Tok a Corea
articles.content:
Hallado archivo de Japon sobre la pertenencia de isla Tok a Corea
Pyongyang, 4 de diciembre (ATCC) -- El profesor de la Universidad de Lenguas Extranjeras de Pusan del Sur de Corea, Kim Mun Gil, anuncio el dia primero que el encontro a principios de este ano en el Museo de Datos Historicos Hamada del Departamento de Shimane de Japon un archivo antiguo comprobando que este pais isleno habia reconocido que la isla Tok pertenece a Corea.
					 Este documento oficial fue expedido en febrero de 1838 por el entonces gobernador de ese departamento japones a todas las aldeas pesqueras para notificar que seran condenados a la pena capital los que entren ilegalmente en la isla Juk (Ulrung).
					
					 El archivo recuerda que en la decada de 1690, An Ryong Bok y otros coreanos llegados a Japon obtuvieron de la parte japonesa el reconocimiento de las islas Ulrung y Tok como tierras coreanas y la garantia de prohibir en el futuro la presencia de los japoneses en estos islotes.
					
					 Despues de ese incidente, el gobierno feudal japones decreto la "orden de prohibicion de pesca" para impedir el acceso de los japoneses a las islas Juk y Song (Tok), apunta y agrega que un pescador que la violo fue condenado a la muerte.
					
					  El gobierno japones ejecuto al propietario de barcos de Yonago del departamento de Tottori, quien realizo la pesca ilicita en la zona maritima de la isla Ulrung infringiendo la orden mencionada, y envio el documento en cuestion a los jefes de las aldeas pesqueras para prevenir la repeticion de tales casos.
					
					  En esta nota de 4 hojas quedan frescas todavia las firmas de los jefes aldeanos de aquel entonces.
					
					  El profesor surcoreano dijo que "segun el archivo de interrogacion abierta por el gobierno japones sobre el naviero ejecutado, la isla Tok estaba incluida en los lugares prohibidos por la referida orden" y subrayo que esto quiere decir que "Japon la reconocio como territorio coreano".
					
					  Estan de acuerdo en esto tambien los intelectuales japoneses, asevero.

articles.title: Minju Joson refuta criticas de Lee Myung Bak a justa medida de RPDC
articles.content:
Minju Joson refuta criticas de Lee Myung Bak a justa medida de RPDC
Pyongyang, 4 de diciembre (ATCC) -- Como ya avisado a la parte surcoreana, la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea puso en vigor a partir del primero de diciembre su importante medida de restringir y bloquear rigurosamente todo el transito terrestre por via de la Linea de Demarcacion Militar. 
					Ahora, la banda de Lee Myung Bak del Sur de Corea censura esta justa medida como "chantaje rutinario" y "estrategia de resistencia porfiada" partiendo de su malsana intencion de imputar a la RPDC la responsabilidad del empeoramiento de las relaciones intercoreanas que corren el riesgo de ruptura total. 
					
					Senala asi el periodico Minju Joson en un comentario individual publicado este jueves y continua:
					
					Las artimanas de toda indole de la horda de Lee nunca podran liberarla de la responsabilidad por la ruptura de las relaciones Norte-Sur. Al contrario, ellas irritan mucho al ejercito y al pueblo de la RPDC porque significan intolerable desafio a esta que se esfuerza por evitar la ruptura total de las relaciones intercoreanas y lograr la reunificacion independiente, la paz y la prosperidad. 
					
					Mientras existe esa banda de traidores, no se puede esperar la mejora de las relaciones intercoreanas ni la paz ni la reunificacion. 
					
					Cuanto mas desesperados fueran los esfuerzos de los titeres surcoreanos por eludir su responsabilidad, tanto mas se agrandaran sus crimenes y el castigo nacional al respecto. 
					
					La banda de Lee debe reconocer, antes de que se haga tarde, esa responsabilidad, pedir disculpas a la nacion coreana y renunciar su "politica sobre el Norte" de caracter fratricida.
